subject: Re: Use standard input--word list?
author: purplespacefriend
full_text:
Yeah, the important thing is that a guy's name on the Speechchip 
group could be easily heard.

 Frnak-S

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, psfponies <psfponies@...> wrote:
>
> The second one sounds like "Personnally I would move to task 
Timothy" ?????
>    
>   Kay
> 
> Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@...> wrote:
>       .hmmessage P  {  margin:0px;  padding:0px  }  body.hmmessage  
{  FONT-SIZE: 10pt;  FONT-FAMILY:Tahoma  }     They seem to be all 
over the sound chip, so it must be important. I almost never get 
technical advice. 'Used As Exactly Standard Into Unit-That'd Be 
Wonderful-(sight-card{Blind Aide?})--Realtime English-Certain 
Contact'. I think it means to not use the random pulses, that would 
just confuse the chip, it'll have to be provided with random words( 
the numbers). Great, load all those numbers into a register/memory, 
and then use a pic chip, or basic stamp to output them randomly to 
the Speakjet--simple!
>  
>  I sent this the Speakjet group too! that oughta make some 
brianiacs heads cock sideways! Especially since one thier names was 
mentioned! 
>  
> 
>   Frank-S
> 
>

Hotmail-get your "fix". Check it out.
